name: vscodeprefsync
description: This extension allows you to synchronize your user settings and key bindings

commands.title: prefsync: Upload your settings and keybindings to a git repository
prefsync: Download settings and keybindings from a git repository
prefsync: Check for changes in current Settings
prefsync: Revert local settings to remote

vscodeprefsync.repositoryUrl.description: Url of the git repository to use for syncing settings

vscodeprefsync.localRepository.description: Where to check out the repository

vscodeprefsync.automaticallyOpenChanges.description: Open the result from a git diff in an editor window after downloading settings or checking for changes

vscodeprefsync.project.description: Unique name. If you want to sync settings.json or other files in your local .vscode directory then provide this setting in your local .vscode/settings.json

vscodeprefsync.files.description: Array of strings. Additional files to be synchronized from your local .vscode folder. You must provide the setting 'vscodeprefsync.project' for this to work
